definition: falling tone/fourth tone in modern Mandarin

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: Rain reads falling tone, be like rain the rain of my fair cropland.
sentences.chinese: 雨读作去声，如雨我公田之雨。

sentences.english: Only the Qu tone in Longchuan Sidu dialect compounds of two characters does not exhibit tone sandhi .
sentences.chinese: 龙川四都话在两字词组中只有去声不变。

definition: entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
level or even tone/first and second tones in modern Mandarin
falling and rising tone/third tone in modern Mandarin
oblique tone/nonlevel tone/uneven tone (the third tone of Classical Chinese)
the four tones of Middle Chinese: level tone 平聲|平声, rising tone 上聲|上声, departing tone 去聲|去声 and entering tone 入聲|入声/the four tones of Modern Standard Mandarin
evenly rising tone, the second tone of putonghua
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
(phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
alveolar/consonants z, c, s produced with the tip of the tongue on the alveolar ridge
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
(Chinese linguistics) zero initial (the initial of a syllable that does not begin with a consonant)
